Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Ring
Description: This is a fragment of a rather large ring, with a half-oval cross section, broken only on one side. The second extremity bears the remains of an enamel paste, which implies that this ring was not closed. This fragment belongs to a group of rings of this particular type found in the same sector. Some have a polished look, just like this one, while others were decorated with a crest all around them. The exterior diametre is about 2,5 cm and the interior diametre approximately 1,7 cm. The thickness of this ring is about 1,4 cm.
